div.h1: Bellevue Public Schools Closure - Coronavirus (COVID-19) Reference Guide

span.span: This page will be where students, families, staff and the community can come for the latest information and links related to BPS' Coronavirus (COVID-19) closure plans.

span.b: The health and safety of our students and staff is our priority at Bellevue Public Schools.Â

span.span: The District continues to work to monitor national and international developments related to COVID-19. We are in regular contact with state and local health officials.
Remindersâ¦

The school year will be adjusted with the last studentÂ day occurringÂ on May 15th.Â The last day for staff will remain May 21st. The last week will allow for staff to handle the checking out needs, grades, and any other necessary items. The District continues to work on plans for both studentÂ and staff checkout; those plans will be communicated out once they are finalized.

The BPS Enrollment Center continues to enroll students, including kindergartners, for the 2020-2021 school year online. Please contact the Enrollment Center by email: bps.enrollment@bpsne.net or Phone: 402-827-8554. Click here for what you'll need to prepare for the registration process.
Student Learning Resources

Bellevue Public Schools has created core learning engagement opportunities for students and parents to use during the extended school closure. These resources will be updated and distributed weekly for students to participate in the provided student engagement schedule with educational opportunities that include extensions and enrichment activities designed for students to review and practice previously taught concepts.Â Learning opportunities completed at home will not be graded since not all students have the ability to submit work electronically. Digital access to these learning resources is also available on the BPS website, and packets can be printed at home if you choose.

a.span: Â Click here for Student Learning Resources

span.span: Your classroom teachers will be reaching out via email and other platforms for ongoing communication and to offer support. Please contact your school or teacher if you have questions or need additional support.

p.span: For those with limited internet access or devices, packets for all grade levels are available at any of our 7 food drive-up sites (Avery, Belleaire, Bertha Barber, Betz, Birchcrest, Peter Sarpy, and Twin Ridge). These sites are open Monday-Friday from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.

span.span: Daily Student Engagement Schedule
The schedule outlines the estimated amount of time for students to engage in learning opportunities each day.

a.span: Click here for Recommended Daily Student Engagement Schedule

span.span: Meal Support for Students
Bellevue Public Schools is extending a program similar to our summer meals program to ensure all students have food at home during this closure.
Drive-up Dates & Times:
Available this week, Monday through Friday from 11:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. We will provide updates if/when changes are made to this schedule or locations.
Avery Elementary (2107 Avery Rd.)
Belleaire Elementary (1200 W Mission Ave.)
Bertha Barber Elementary (1402 Main St.)
Betz Elementary (605 W 27th Ave.)
Birchcrest Elementary (1212 Fairfax Dr.)
Peter Sarpy Elementary (2908 Vandenberg Ave.)
Twin Ridge Elementary (1400 Sunbury Dr.)
Every child who shows up (ages 1-18) at one of our drive up sites will receive meals (breakfast and lunch) to take home. There is no charge, and no ID is required.

*FoodBank for the Heartland has several drive-through food distributions scheduled across the metro area, as well as several food pantry partners also providing food for community members. Additional information here: Â https://foodbankheartland.org/covid-19/

a.span: Click here for the BPS High School Grade Recovery Procedures

span.span: Both Bellevue East and Bellevue West Proms have been postponed. If it is possible to do so, we will try and reschedule this important milestone.

Graduation: To the Class of 2020, we are so proud of the hard work you have demonstrated over the years, your accomplishments, and the strength youâre showing through this challenging time.
We have set a new date for Graduation ceremonies for both Bellevue East and Bellevue West High Schools â our hope is to conduct the ceremonies in the school gymsÂ on Saturday, August 1, 2020, if the Governor's Directed Health Measure (DHM) order allows.
We have a team working on virtual celebrations for the originally scheduled date (Saturday, May 23rd) that will recognize our seniors while prioritizing everyoneâs health and safety. We believe the class of 2020 deserves to be recognizedÂ for their outstanding efforts and weâre working to make that happen. We will continue to share information as details are finalized.

span.br: The best way to help prevent the spread of the Coronavirus is to prevent the spread of germs. We encourage families to partner with us in the effort and talk with your children.

span.span: Good hand washing with soap for at least 20 seconds. Particularly after going to the bathroom, before eating and after blowing your nose, coughing or sneezing.
Keeping hands away from nose, mouth, and eyes.
Avoid close contact with sick people (recommended 6 ft away).
Stay home and keep your children home when sick.
Remind children the importance of using healthy behavior at school.

br.span: We want to reiterate that the goal of a community closure is to limit the spread of the virus. We ask that staff, families and community membersÂ followÂ the guidance of the CDC and our Health Departments. The CDC recommends the best way to stop the spread in a community is to limit exposure to others.Â

span.span: Where can I find more information?Â
CDC Coronavirus Summary: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/index.html
CDC Frequently Asked Questions & Answers: https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/faq.html
Sarpy/Cass Health Department: https://www.sarpycasshealthdepartment.org/novel-coronavirus
We are still checking messages, please be patient as we work to respond to them.Â
Not sure who to contact, you can use our Letâs Talk feature.
BPS staff are working remotely and will be available by email. Please allow time for them to reply, as staff are also tending to their families during this closure.

Bellevue Public Schools will communicate relevant updates to staff, students, and families on a regular basis. Look to official district channels (email, district website, social media) for information.Â
